| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | December 3, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs recent internal Code Red memo reveals a serious response to emerging competitive threats from rivals like Google‚Äôs Gemini and Anthropic. This unexpected shift has raised questions about imminent updates to ChatGPT and the broader implications for the AI sector.

Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Top 15 New AI Advancements (This Year)
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | November 30, 2025
The latest developments in artificial intelligence are showcased, highlighting transformative technologies and innovative models that are impacting various sectors such as medicine, climate science, and cybersecurity. Key advancements illustrate how AI is accelerating scientific discovery and enhancing everyday life, revealing a pivotal year for technological evolution.
B.)
ChatGPT‚Äôs New Voice Mode, Group Chats, Shopping Research & More!
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | November 28, 2025
Igor reviews the latest features introduced in ChatGPT, including an innovative Voice Mode, group chat functionalities, and advanced shopping research capabilities. Additionally, he covers significant developments in the AI field, such as Meta SAM 3, Flux.2, and Codex Max, providing viewers with a comprehensive overview of the week‚Äôs highlights.
C.)
The ‚ÄúNano Banana‚Äù of AI Video Is Here!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | December 1, 2025
Kling 01 introduces a revolutionary shift in AI video generation, merging text, images, and advanced understanding into a cohesive system. With features such as the Elements Library for character consistency and the ability to manipulate footage through natural language commands, this is poised to reshape the landscape of AI filmmaking.
D.)
Notepad: Get Back What They Took From You!
| Dave‚Äôs Garage | YouTube.com | December 1, 2025
Dave demonstrates how to recreate the classic Notepad experience using GPT Codex Max 5.1 in Extra High mode, restoring beloved features that users have missed. This presentation also offers a free sample of his book on the Spectrum and highlights exciting Black Friday deals on Slate devices.
E.)
N8N 8 Hour Masterclass: Build & Sell AI Agents (Automate Anything)
| Jono Catliff | YouTube.com | November 27, 2025
Join Jono in an intensive 8-hour masterclass designed to empower you with the skills to build and monetize AI agents using n8n. Learn through ten practical workflows that showcase the potential of automation in various business applications.

| AI-Weekly.ai | December 9, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
December 8, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
Claude Code In Slack
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 8, 2025
Teams can now seamlessly delegate tasks to Claude Code directly from Slack, facilitating a smooth transition from conversation to coding. This integration enhances workflow efficiency for users with the Claude app installed in their Slack workspaces and access to Claude Code on the web.
6.)
Diffusion LLMs? Inside Inception Labs‚Äô New Breakthrough with Stefano Ermon
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | December 8, 2025
Corey Noles interviews Inception Labs co-founder Stefano Ermon to discuss the groundbreaking application of diffusion-based large language models in AI. The conversation delves into the innovative capabilities of Mercury and Mercury Coder, exploring their potential to surpass traditional transformer-based systems in efficiency and reasoning.
7.)
How Anthropic Uses Claude in Legal
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 8, 2025
Mark Pike, Associate General Counsel at Anthropic, reveals how their legal team leverages Claude to streamline workflows, significantly reducing routine tasks like contract redlining and marketing reviews. This innovative approach transforms review times from days to hours, enabling the lawyers to focus on higher-value work.
8.)
Interview Practice With ChatGPT
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | December 8, 2025
Boost confidence and performance in job interviews by engaging in interactive practice sessions with ChatGPT. This innovative approach enables users to rehearse their responses and fine-tune their communication skills effectively.
9.)
Building The Chip That Could Unlock AGI | Naveen Rao
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 8, 2025
Naveen Rao discusses the transformative potential of analog computing systems for artificial intelligence with Matt Bornstein at NeurIPS. Covering the efficiency of the brain compared to contemporary data centers, they explore the implications of this unconventional approach for achieving artificial general intelligence.
December 7, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
10.)
15 Futuristic Gadgets You‚Äôll Actually Use by 2026
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | December 7, 2025
Explore the near-future landscape of technology with 15 innovative gadgets poised to enhance everyday life by 2026. These advancements span areas such as AI assistants, wearable health devices, and smart home tools, all aimed at streamlining how we live, work, and interact with our environment.
11.)
Almost Timely News: How to Update Old Content With AI
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | December 7, 2025
Christopher Penn reveals effective techniques for revamping legacy content using generative AI. By employing a four-part audit framework, he identifies critical areas for updates, transforming static text into dynamic tools that enhance user engagement. Additionally, a real-time demonstration illustrates how to create a custom software wizard for blog posts without any coding required.
December 6, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
12.)
Did We Just Get the Nano Banana of Video?
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | December 6, 2025
Innovative AI video models are put to the test under real creator workflows to reveal their practical usability in today‚Äôs landscape. This chaotic exploration spans from the latest offerings like Kling‚Äôs models to Apple‚Äôs STARFlow-V, examining how these advancements may influence upcoming video projects across platforms.
December 5, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
13.)
AI Search: Make Your Brand the #1 Choice (Copy These SEO Methods)
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | December 5, 2025
Harnessing the power of AI is essential for brands to excel in today‚Äôs digital landscape. Discover six actionable methods to enhance your SEO strategies and ensure your brand remains visible and compelling in an AI-driven search environment.
14.)
Anthropic‚Äôs Philosopher Answers Your Questions
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 5, 2025
Amanda Askell, a philosopher at Anthropic, engages with community inquiries about her work on Claude‚Äôs character, exploring the intersection of philosophy and AI. Key topics include moral decision-making by AI models, the significance of model identity, and contemporary philosophical influences on AI behavior.
15.)
DeepSeek Is Back & More AI News You Can Use
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | December 5, 2025
Igor showcases the impressive new DeepSeek model and details its implications that led OpenAI to activate the ‚Äúcode red‚Äù alert. Additionally, insights into the Runway 4.5 video model and the recent OpenAI security leak are provided, offering viewers actionable information amid a rapidly evolving AI landscape.
16.)
OpenAI‚Äôs Code Red: Can New AI Models Hold Off Google Gemini?
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | December 5, 2025
At OpenAI, a ‚ÄòCode Red‚Äô has been declared by Sam Altman in response to the competitive threat posed by Google Gemini 3. New advancements, including the Garlic and Shallotpeat models, showcase potential to regain a competitive edge, even as various AI models capture significant attention across the market.
17.)
Top 15 New Wearable Tech That‚Äôll Make You Feel Like You‚Äôre a Cyborg‚Ä¶
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | December 5, 2025
Explore the remarkable advancements in wearable technology that merge human capability with machine intelligence. From AI-powered exoskeletons to mind-controlled devices, these innovations not only enhance everyday life but also signal the dawn of a new era in human augmentation.
18.)
What‚Äôs New With ChatGPT Voice
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | December 5, 2025
ChatGPT Voice is now integrated directly into the chat interface, allowing seamless communication without the need for a separate mode. Users can engage in conversation while accessing real-time answers, visuals, and past messages, enhancing the overall interactive experience.
19.)
You Are Being Told Contradictory Things About AI
| AI Explained | YouTube.com | December 5, 2025
Conflicting narratives surrounding AI‚Äôs future create confusion, with alarms raised over job losses and breakthroughs in AGI capabilities. The discussion analyzes current expert opinions alongside the latest technological advancements, allowing viewers to navigate the complexities of AI discourse and form their own conclusions.
20.)
Meta AI Expands Real-Time News Coverage With More Diverse Content Sources For Better News Responses
| About.fb.com | December 5, 2025
Meta AI will now offer a broader range of real-time content, including global news, entertainment, lifestyle stories, and more across our apps and devices. As a first step, we are partnering with publications such as CNN, Fox News, Le Monde Group, People Inc., and USA TODAY Co., Inc. Our goal over time is to provide something for everyone by continuing to add new content sources and topics.
21.)
ChatGPT User Growth Slows To 5% From August To November, Lagging Behind Gemini‚Äôs 30% Increase
| TechCrunch.com | December 5, 2025
ChatGPT‚Äôs growth is starting to taper off, according to new data from market intelligence firm Sensor Tower. Today, the OpenAI-owned AI chatbot remains the leader in the space, accounting for 50% of global downloads on mobile devices and 55% of the global monthly active users. However, Google‚Äôs Gemini has begun to outpace ChatGPT in terms of download growth, growth of monthly active users, and growth of time spent in app, the firm found.
22.)
New York Times Sues Perplexity For Copyright Infringement Over AI Use Of News Content
| TechCrunch.com | December 5, 2025
The New York Times filed suit Friday against AI search startup Perplexity for copyright infringement, its second lawsuit against an AI company. The Times joins several media outlets suing Perplexity, including the Chicago Tribune, which also filed suit this week.
23.)
OpenAI May Launch GPT-5.2 Next Week In Rapid Response To Google, Rumored Release Set For December 9
| TheVerge.com | December 5, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman declared a ‚Äúcode red‚Äù situation earlier this week, pushing staff to respond quickly to increased competition from Google and Anthropic. Sources familiar with OpenAI‚Äôs plans tell me that the company is planning its first response to Gemini 3 with its upcoming GPT-5.2 update.
24.)
Netflix To Acquire Warner Bros. For $83 Billion, Future Of HBO Max Branding Uncertain
| TheVerge.com | December 5, 2025
Netflix has announced that it‚Äôs struck a deal to acquire Warner Bros. for $82.7 billion. The purchase will go through after Warner Bros.‚Äô planned split from Discovery, now expected to take place in Q3 2026. It will see the streamer acquire the Warner studio, both HBO and HBO Max, and access to IP, including Harry Potter, Game of Thrones, and DC Comics.
25.)
Google Unveils Gemini 3 Pro, Advancing Multimodal AI Vision Capabilities For Developers
| Blog.google | December 5, 2025
Gemini 3 Pro delivers state-of-the-art performance across document, spatial, screen and video understanding.
26.)
Google Increases Antigravity Rate Limits For AI Pro And Ultra Subscribers To Meet Rising Demand
| Blog.google | December 5, 2025
The response to Google Antigravity, our new agentic development platform, has been incredible and we‚Äôre working to meet this demand. One way we‚Äôre doing this is by offering enhanced support for Google AI subscribers.
December 4, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
27.)
AWS Just Made Some Massive Announcements
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | December 4, 2025
AWS has unveiled significant updates to AgentCore, introducing quality evaluations and policy controls to enhance the deployment of trusted AI agents. This initiative aims to streamline AI operations while ensuring accountability and integrity in AI technologies.
28.)
Build Hour: Agent Memory Patterns
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | December 4, 2025
Emre Okcular explores the significance of memory in AI agents, showcasing techniques for enhancing both short-term and long-term memory. The session includes live demonstrations and best practices for personalized interactions and maintaining reliable workflows throughout the agent‚Äôs lifecycle.
29.)
Give Me 9 Minutes, I‚Äôll Make You AI-Native
| Jeff Su | YouTube.com | December 4, 2025
Discover how to integrate AI into your daily workflow through practical habits and innovative systems. Learn to leave AI breadcrumbs, create a comprehensive AI swipe file, and plan tasks with an AI-first approach to enhance productivity and quality of work.
30.)
Here‚Äôs Why ChatGPT May Not Survive 2026
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | December 4, 2025
Examining six unique uses for ChatGPT reveals intriguing alternatives that may perform these tasks more effectively. The competition is heating up with emerging platforms like Gemini, Claude, and DeepSeek, encouraging users to explore diverse workflow options beyond ChatGPT.
31.)
Kling Goes Beast Mode & Seedream Gets Bananas!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | December 4, 2025
Kling 2.6 introduces groundbreaking features such as native audio and lip sync to enhance text-to-video and image-to-video capabilities, pushing the boundaries of professional AI filmmaking. Meanwhile, Seedream 4.5 from ByteDance sets a new standard in AI image generation, showcasing exceptional temporal consistency and adaptability across various decades.
32.)
Top 15 Secret Tech Projects Governments Don‚Äôt Want You to Know About
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | December 4, 2025
Uncover the hidden world of classified technologies and secret government projects that remain unseen by the public. Explore groundbreaking advancements in surveillance, autonomous weapons, and AI that could dramatically change our future, as well as the implications for global security and privacy.
33.)
Microsoft Hires Bloomberg Media Coo Julia Beizer To Lead AI News Product Development
| AdWeek.com | December 4, 2025
Gemini 3 Deep Think is now available in the Gemini app. Today, we‚Äôre rolling out Gemini 3 Deep Think mode to Google AI Ultra subscribers in the Gemini app. This new mode delivers a meaningful improvement in reasoning capabilities, designed to tackle complex math, science and logic problems that challenge even the most advanced state-of-the-art models.
34.)
Google Launches Gemini 3 Deep Think Mode For AI Ultra Subscribers In Gemini App
| Blog.google | December 4, 2025
Gemini 3 Deep Think is now available in the Gemini app. Today, we‚Äôre rolling out Gemini 3 Deep Think mode to Google AI Ultra subscribers in the Gemini app. This new mode delivers a meaningful improvement in reasoning capabilities, designed to tackle complex math, science and logic problems that challenge even the most advanced state-of-the-art models.
35.)
Yahoo Uses AI To Deliver Real-Time Football Game Recaps Beyond Traditional Box Scores
| TheVerge.com | December 4, 2025
AI models are very useful for mining stats to see exactly what‚Äôs going on in the game you‚Äôre watching.
36.)
Introducing Anthropic Interviewer: What 1,250 Professionals Told Us About Working With AI
| Anthropic.com | December 4, 2025
We‚Äôre launching a new tool, Anthropic Interviewer, to help understand people‚Äôs perspectives on AI. In this research post, we introduce the tool, describe a test of it on a sample of professionals, and discuss our early findings. We also discuss future work in this direction that we can now explore with the development of this tool and through partnerships with creatives, scientists, and teachers.
December 3, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
37.)
You Can Actually Search Videos Now W/ Twelve Labs
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | December 3, 2025
Danny Nicolopoulos from TwelveLabs shares insights into the transformative power of multimodal AI in making video data accessible and usable for enterprises. Explore real-world applications and the future potential of video-native AI in enhancing business intelligence at AWS re:Invent 2025.
38.)
OpenAI Goes Nuclear (Code Red)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | December 3, 2025
In response to heightened competition, OpenAI‚Äôs leadership declares a state of urgency to enhance its AI services. This critical pivot emphasizes the launch of ChatLLM, an all-in-one AI solution designed to outperform current offerings by a significant margin.
39.)
OpenAI‚Äôs Code Red Explained
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | December 3, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs recent internal Code Red memo reveals a serious response to emerging competitive threats from rivals like Google‚Äôs Gemini and Anthropic. This unexpected shift has raised questions about imminent updates to ChatGPT and the broader implications for the AI sector.
40.)
The Future of Windows: AI-Native Computing with Pavan Davuluri
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | December 3, 2025
Pavan Davuluri, Corporate Vice President of Microsoft‚Äôs Windows + Devices division, outlines the transformative journey of Windows as it evolves into an AI-native platform. This episode delves into the integration of AI technologies like Copilot, the engineering challenges faced, and how Microsoft is balancing automation with user control to redefine the Windows experience.
41.)
Why AI Moats Still Matter (And How They‚Äôve Changed
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 3, 2025
A16z General Partners David Haber, Alex Rampell, and Erik Torenberg analyze the challenging landscape for AI startups, revealing that many will struggle to survive in a market where the few successful can radically increase pricing. Insights include the importance of software defensibility, the nuances of market competition, and emerging trends in legal AI development.
42.)
Google Launches Workspace Studio To Automate Tasks And Workflows With Gemini 3 AI Agents
| Workspace.google.com | December 3, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing the general availability of Google Workspace Studio, the place to design, manage, and share AI agents in Workspace. Harnessing the reasoning power and multimodal understanding of Gemini 3, we‚Äôve built AI automation that‚Äôs simple to use, deeply integrated into Google Workspace, and puts custom agent creation in the hands of every employee. With Workspace Studio, you can build agents in minutes to automate everyday work, from simple tasks to complex workflows, no coding or specialized syntax required.
43.)
Amazon Unveils Alexa Plus Feature To Let Users Skip Directly To Specific Movie Scenes On Fire TV
| TheVerge.com | December 3, 2025
The AI feature allows Fire TV users to describe the movie moment they want to watch on Prime Video without fast-forwarding.
44.)
Krea AI Launches Node App Builder For Easy Workflow-To-App Transformation
| X.com | December 3, 2025
Introducing Node App Builder. Turn your workflows into a simple apps that anyone can use.
45.)
Kling AI Launches Video 2.6: First Model With Native Audio For Enhanced Multimedia Experience
| X.com | December 3, 2025
Day 3: Meet VIDEO 2.6: Kling AI‚Äôs First Model with Native Audio. Generate an entire experience, more than a video clip! With coherent looking & sounding output, the 2.6 model opens up narrative possibilities, and makes you ‚ÄúSee the Sound, Hear the Visual‚Äù.
46.)
OpenAI‚Äôs Code Red: What It Means For The AI Race
| MattWolfe.com | December 3, 2025
By now you‚Äôve probably heard whispers about OpenAI‚Äôs Code Red internal memo. Maybe you saw the headlines but didn‚Äôt dig into the details. Here‚Äôs what you need to know: OpenAI just went into full panic mode, and it says a lot about where the AI industry is headed.
December 2, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
47.)
AI Fluency For Nonprofits Course Trailer
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 2, 2025
Explore an innovative educational journey designed to empower nonprofits with artificial intelligence fluency. Developed by Anthropic and Giving Tuesday, this course fosters understanding and practical applications of AI in the nonprofit sector.
48.)
Deepseek Did It Again‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | December 2, 2025
Discover how Deepseek is streamlining workflows with innovative solutions like Zapier Copilot, enabling users to automate repetitive tasks effortlessly. Explore valuable resources and workflows shared by Matthew Berman, enhancing productivity in the age of AI.
49.)
Getting Started With Claude.ai
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 2, 2025
Explore the essentials of Claude‚Äôs conversational interface, focusing on techniques for crafting effective prompts, uploading documents, and customizing your user experience. Gain insights into advanced features like extended thinking and research mode to enhance interactions with this AI tool.
50.)
Getting Started With Projects In Claude.ai
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 2, 2025
Gain insights into leveraging Projects within Claude.ai for better work organization. This session highlights the essentials of creating a project, establishing a knowledge base, and setting tailored instructions to foster effective collaboration among team members.
51.)
Getting Started With Research In Claude.ai
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 2, 2025
Claude.ai‚Äôs Research feature revolutionizes the way information is gathered and analyzed, streamlining processes that typically require extensive manual effort. Effective prompt crafting, alongside insights into extended thinking, empowers users to tackle complex tasks like market analysis and event planning with ease.
52.)
Shaping Model Behavior in GPT-5.1 ‚Äî  The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 11
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | December 2, 2025
Christina Kim and Laurentia Romaniuk explore the nuances of AI model personality, detailing OpenAI‚Äôs approach to balancing intellectual and emotional capabilities in GPT-5.1. The discussion emphasizes the importance of user feedback and the challenges in steering model behavior to achieve a more adaptable and engaging AI experience.
53.)
She Built NotebookLM. Now She‚Äôs Creating The ‚ÄòSpotify of AI‚Äô
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | December 2, 2025
Raiza Martin, a pioneer behind Google‚Äôs NotebookLM, now leads Huxe, a startup focused on personalized audio content. In this episode, she discusses the intersection of AI and daily habits, emphasizing the importance of privacy and the potential for AI to enhance everyday experiences without user initiation.
54.)
Apple Unveils Starflow-V: First End-To-End Normalizing Flow Model For High-Quality Video Generation
| Starflow-v.github.io | December 2, 2025
STARFlow-V is the first normalizing flow-based causal video generator demonstrating that normalizing flows can match video diffusion models in visual quality while offering end-to-end training, exact likelihood estimation, and native multi-task support across T2V/I2V/V2V generation.
55.)
OpenAI Teases New Garlic AI Model To Compete With Google‚Äôs Recent Advancements In Language Models
| TheInformation.com | December 2, 2025
OpenAI is reportedly developing a new large language model internally codenamed ‚ÄòGarlic‚Äô to compete with Google‚Äôs recent AI advancements and regain market momentum. The model has shown strong performance in internal evaluations.
56.)
Amazon Unveils Trainium3 AI Chip And Announces Nvidia-Compatible Roadmap For AWS Platforms
| TechCrunch.com | December 2, 2025
Amazon Web Services, which has been building its own AI training chips for years now, just introduced a new version known as Trainium3 that comes with some impressive specs.
57.)
OpenAI Issues ‚ÄòCode Red‚Äô As Google Rapidly Advances In AI Competition With ChatGPT Rival
| TheVerge.com | December 2, 2025
The tides are turning in the AI race, and the pressure is getting to OpenAI. Chief executive Sam Altman reportedly declared a ‚Äúcode red‚Äù on Monday, urging staff to improve its flagship product ChatGPT, an indicator that the startup‚Äôs once-unassailable lead is eroding as competitors like Google and Anthropic close in.
58.)
AWS Unveils AI Factory To Deliver Dedicated On-Premises AI Infrastructure With Nvidia Or Trainium Chips
| DataCenterDynamics.com | December 2, 2025
Amazon Web Services (AWS) has launched a new AWS AI Factory offering that brings AI infrastructure to customers‚Äô data centers. Revealed at the company‚Äôs Re:Invent 2025 conference in Las Vegas, the AI Factory offering sees AWS bring AI infrastructure, including Nvidia GPUs, Trainium chips, and AWS networking, storage, and databases to customers‚Äô own data centers.
59.)
Amazon Unveils Autonomous Frontier AI Agents To Transform Software Development, Security, And Operations
| AboutAmazon.com | December 2, 2025
The first three frontier agents revolutionize how you build, secure, and operate software.
60.)
Anthropic Details How AI Is Reshaping Workflows And Productivity Across Its Organization
| Anthropic.com | December 2, 2025
How is AI changing the way we work? Our previous research on AI‚Äôs economic impacts looked at the labor market as a whole, covering a variety of different jobs. But what if we studied some of the earliest adopters of AI technology in more detail, namely, us?
61.)
Anthropic Launches Claude For Nonprofits With Free AI Training And Discounts For Organizations
| Anthropic.com | December 2, 2025
Nonprofits tackle some of society‚Äôs most difficult problems, often with limited resources. In partnership with the global generosity movement GivingTuesday, we‚Äôre launching Claude for Nonprofits to help organizations across the world maximize their impact.
62.)
Anthropic Acquires Bun As Claude Code Hits $1B Milestone In AI Safety And Research Expansion
| Anthropic.com | December 2, 2025
Claude is the world‚Äôs smartest and most capable AI model for developers, startups, and enterprises. Claude Code represents a new era of agentic coding, fundamentally changing how teams build software. In November, Claude Code achieved a significant milestone: just six months after becoming available to the public, it reached $1 billion in run-rate revenue. And today we‚Äôre announcing that Anthropic is acquiring Bun, a breakthrough JavaScript runtime, to further accelerate Claude Code.
63.)
Mistral AI Unveils Mistral 3, A New Open-Source Family Of Frontier Multimodal AI Models
| Mistral.ai | December 2, 2025
Today, we announce Mistral 3, the next generation of Mistral models. Mistral 3 includes three state-of-the-art small, dense models (14B, 8B, and 3B) and Mistral Large 3 ‚Äì our most capable model to date ‚Äì a sparse mixture-of-experts trained with 41B active and 675B total parameters. All models are released under the Apache 2.0 license. Open-sourcing our models in a variety of compressed formats empowers the developer community and puts AI in people‚Äôs hands through distributed intelligence.

With Tigris, you can instantly create an isolated copy of your
data
for development, testing, or experimentation. Have a massive production dataset you want to play with? You don‚Äôt need to wait for a full copy. Just fork your source bucket, experiment freely, throw it away, and spin up a new one ‚Äî instantly.
Bucket forks are perfect for:
Isolated environments for safer experimentation
Built-in version control and reproducibility
Reliable A/B testing and multi-model training
Agent-friendly sandboxing
Under the hood: immutable object versions + timestamped snapshots = time travel for your entire dataset.
